CatDescriptText: Mrs. Edith Eaglin, domestic, 1843 Wylie Avenue, was part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 2, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think waitresses should be paid a minimum of $1 per hour plus tips?" answer reads: "Yes, I do, because the average waitress does not work but five days a week. The cost of everything, including the upkeep of her appearance, is higher.  They work hard, and are entitled to a minimum of $1 an hour plus the tips they get."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Edith Eaglin wearing abstract flower and square patterned sleeveless dress, holding snow cone cup in left hand, standing on sidewalk with automobiles and brick buildings
